question: The Paika rebellion of 1817 against British colonialism is associated to which modern state of India?
explanation: When the British started tinkering with the revenue system in 1803, the farming community of Odisha rose in rebellion. At that critical juncture, Bakshi Jagabandhu Bidyadhar — the military chief of the King of Khurda led his motley army of Paikas forcing the British East India Company forces to retreat.The rebellion came to be known as Paika Bidroh (Paika rebellion).
